The great thing about Casey Jones is that you don't have to be a barfly or sports fanatic to have a great time.    While Casey Jones does offer the sports bar experience, it offers more than that too.   In fact, the majority people come for the great food and fun atmosphere.  Lots of appetizers are on the menu.  My favorite is the loaded potato skins.  My husband is a big chicken wing fan; he eats them until they're coming out his ears.  There are lots of burgers and hot sandwiches too.  I always order the Jalapeno Cheesesteak, thinly sliced beef, cooked with mushrooms, onions, peppers and jalapenos, and served with melted pepper jack cheese.  I'm not much of a drinker, but I know they have a full bar serving both the usual stuff and also specialty drinks.  They also have a huge variety of beer.  Prices are a great value and always several food, drink, or happy hour specials.   Casey Jones offers live music on special nights of the week.  This place is fun, not too rowdy, but a great place to hang out with friends and have a tasty meal.  (Because I want to be totally open, I need to say that I'm an acquaintance of one of the owners here, not close friends, but wanted to mention it in the spirit of transparency.)

Great for Packer's games! However, I don't think I would go there for anything else. They actually have a pretty nice selection of tap beers and from what I saw, the food looked pretty standard. We had the nachos, which really didn't distinguish themselves from any other nacho platter I have had at a bar. The service was decent, given the fact that they were running a pretty full house during the Packer game.

Awesome little dive bar. Very relaxed atmosphere, fun crowd. Great service and while the food is not 5 star, it is definitely on the higher end of the "bar food" spectrum.   All in all, the chill atmosphere, great music and service keep me coming back!
I love their cheesesteaks. And I love the beer on tap- it is the coldest beer I have ever had and I look forward to it. YUM! Wish they still had Sam Adams on tap though. ;-(

By far the best pulled pork sandwich ever!  It's called the Carolina.   The coleslaw was sweet and crisp with the right amount of sauce.  The pulled pork was so smokey and fall apart juicy.  The food was timed perfect and out within 15 mins of sitting down.   Service was fast and friendly.  And if your a packer fan this is the place for you.  Tons of tvs and the most Green Bay Packer Fans I've ever seen.   Looked like a sea of green!

Nice drink and food prices. My gf and I order regularly from here, eating in and to go... everything is great. The bar is big and I've never had trouble finding a bar stool. Lots of tables/booths if you decide to eat there. Good job guys/gals!

As a diehard Packer fan living in Phoenix, I have been going to Casey Jones' for 4 seasons almost every Sunday.  Each year has progressively gotten worse than the last.  Service is appalling, food quality is dirt poor (except for the wings), everything is filthy, and the hospitality, overall, is terrible.  A week ago I went in; it started the season off on a bad note... I even called the manager over to explain that I am a loyal customer and hadn't seen it this bad EVER.  He didn't have much to say as I gave him some gentle feedback on my experiences, he didn't even apologize or thank me for my loyal business.  I pledged to myself I will never drop another nickel in that place again after that.  Not even for a DIE HARD Packer fan...

This place is fantastic. I had a Philly Cheese steak that was greasy and delicious. They have a pretty varied menu so you're sure to find at least a few things you like.  It's a bar so don't expect it to be quiet, especially on game days but there are lots of families who come here to eat.

Seems they decided to go back to their regular HH menu specials. Hurray! Funny how those poor management decisions always have a way of fixing themselves (one way or another).  All I know is I get to put Casey's back on my HH list. Yippee!  Still haven't been brave enough to order the potato skins again (see first review) but the wings (now 5 cents more) are always exceptional.  Friday night fish fry isn't all you can eat, but you won't leave hungry ordering either the 3 or 5 piece option.

I've been here twice for karaoke.  Brad is a great host and we will follow him to whatever place he has karaoke.  This place isn't horrible, but it's not that great either. It's your basic old dive bar.  It's a bit too bright in there for my liking, and it's set up more for lunch and dinner than singing and dancing.  I heard this place is a Packer bar and it gets pretty crazy for the Packer games.  If you're a Packer fan then check it out for sure.

I visit here regularly and get the cheesesteak. By far my number 1 favorite cheese steak in all the surrounding cities of Phoenix. all the food is great here, i try and bring friends when i can. love the atmosphere and toy trains moving about above everyone's head. lots of tv's and the staff has always been super awesome. everyone should try this place out if they are in the area, it's hard to be dissapointed. It's a true Gem.  The only complaint I have is that it's a Green Bay packers bar. We need more arizona cardinals bars!!! This is after all Arizona!
Thank you! Warm and delightful. Even as a singular woman I was totally comfortable, good food and Jim was kind and attentive. Doesn't hurt that it's a green bay packers place.
Truly a local gem in the valley!  The only downfall is that it's a Packer bar, but that's a fact I'll overlook to have a small taste of the Midwest in the desert!
Brayden and shaun Will def take care if you

My friend and I came here because the Greek restaurant nearby closed early.  But, gawd, it was a Saturday night and the fact that I was in a giant megaplex urban sprawl of a city was very apparent when I noticed how desolate this strip mall location was.    We walked in and what looked like could easily be a very happening sports bar was dotted with a few customers here and there. We sat at the bar, but there were booths and tables to choose from.  There are pool tables, dart boards, and fooseball on the other half of the place and there are 2 sections of outdoor seating.  The beer selection was kind of weak, a bunch of your basic domestics, but Ithey did have Guinness and my Newcastle, but my heart sunk when the bartender told me that they were out of it.  The menu seemed like your average barfood fare, but I was drawn toward what turned out to be an amazing jalapeno cheesesteak sandwich with jalapeno cheese...mmm yeah! And my friend had the hot buffalo wings which, unfortunately, were not hot enough for my fire capacity.  I make it out to Phoenix a few times a year and I would come back to check out the "All you can eat fish fry" (my good diet gets completely thrown out the window when I come here).  And there were some other happy our specials painted on the windows that looked good.  I won't expect a song and dance from our bartender, although accommodating and efficient, possessed the antithesis of a sparkling personality.  I give this place the upper echelon of 2 stars cuz it seems like a place I would have torn up back in the day.

I've been going to Casey Jones for pretty much my entire life. I'm 29yrs old. It's been a family favorite for as long as I can remember.   The food is consistently great. They have the best wings hands down. I've never tried anything I didn't like on the menu. The employees are always friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming. Our 2 year old son loves going to see the trains. They will happily put whatever game you want on the tv near you. The patrons are friendly and it's easy to end up chatting with people sitting near you. Their specials are great and it seems there is always a special on something no matter what time of day you go.   This place is a true gem and we will continue to give them our business. We love you Casey Jones!!
We only come here for two reasons. 1. To pregame  2. To play Buck Hunt.
Anthony was very nice man and the food was delicious I would come back again  is worth going to

I had the philly cheese steak with mushrooms, onions, peppers, and fries. It was a lot of food and the sandwich was very good. The fries were pretty standard bar fries, still goo. Service was also good and attentive. I'll be back to try a burger.

The best bar and bar food around. I tried this years ago and was not impressed. But now that I move back in the area they have completely upped there quality in food! Amazing burger, spinach Queso dip I crave on a weekly bases. Pretzel with there house beer cheese is awesome, cheese curds are the real thing!  If there is anything I wish they would chant or update, is they need to do something about there Wifi. Also, they need to do like homemade French fries, not the standard ones in the big frozen brow bag.  But seriously this place is a much try and make it your home and local bar/restaurant to go too!

Seriously, I'd rather just eat at the Cafeteria at work than at Casey Jone's Grill.  The food is average at best, the service is beyond slow.  The whole restaurant/bar needs to be pressure washed.  I won't be going back.  Nothing about it was worth the time or the money.
This place has gone down hill the last few years,  not as clean as it used to be,  food is mediocre,  and the beer is not always as cold as I like... what happened Casey's???
